## Introduction

The goal of this presentation is to provide preliminary estimations of the impact of two transfer programs that were implemented in Paraguay in 2020, in response to the Covid Pandemic.

This are the Pytyvo and Ñangareko.

To do this, we will use the panel component from the Household Surveys in Panama, evaluating the impact of this transfers using data for those individuals who were followed across time.

Given the data structure, we will be implementing a simple 2x2 DID estimator. 


---
class: left

## Data 

We will concentrate on population age 17-69 in 2019. This will keep the comparison samples homogeneous in terms of age structure.

General Structure of data:


| Survay Year | Obs| Linked Obs | Tr Pytyvo | Tr Ñangareko|
|------:|---:|---:|---:|
| 2019 | 11473| 4293 |  1144 |  179 |
| 2020 | 11099| 4293 | 1144 |  179 |

As outcomes, we will concentrate on few outcome variables:
1. Employment status (work or does not work)
2. Hours of work. (As extensive margin effect)
3. Earnings (For those with earnings in both periods)
---

## Model

2x2  DID Simple:

$$ ATT =E(\Delta Y|D=1) - E(\Delta Y|D=1) $$

2x2 IPW and IPWRA

$$ ATT =E(\Delta Y|D=1,X) - E(\Delta Y|D=0,X) $$

In both cases, the control group will be those who do not declare to have received ANY of the Cash transfers.

# Results

```stata
Ñangareko Trt=121 cntr = 3028
     tr1 |     dwork     dtime      dinc
---------+------------------------------
       0 | -.0052761 -5.128723  .1910545
       1 |  .0247636 -7.483465 -.1465863
---------+------------------------------

Pytyvo trt=1086  cntr = 3028
     tr2 |     dwork     dtime      dinc
---------+------------------------------
       0 | -.0052761 -5.128723  .1910545
       1 | -.0280861 -7.332173 -.0598658
----------------------------------------
```
Message: With no controls
- Ñangareko: PPl work more, but for fewer hours and less income
- Pytyvo: PPl work less,  fewer hours, and less income

---

# Results

There is reason to believe the effect is weaker among males:
